Transfer Credit: Students may double count one course taken for the Arabic Studies minor that is also being used to fulfill the requirements of other majors, minors, and programs. This does not include double-counting with General Education requirements.
Notes: CMU-Q students who place out of the core courses as determined by the campus advisor for Arabic Studies must take four (or more) courses from List A courses, conducted in Arabic, and two (or fewer) courses from List B, conducted in English. Students who place higher than 82-212 in the core courses section must take a total of 27 units in Core Courses since anything beyond intermediate arabic is 9 units. Students must complete two courses (18 units) from List A, and one course (9 units) from List B, or three courses (27 units) from List A. In list A, Students may repeat these courses with new topics. In B list, This list is compiled from possibilities such as but not limited to the following. Students should consult OLR and their minor advisor for the most up to date interdisciplinary electives appropriate for the Arabic Studies curriculum. Courses may be suggested to the minor advisor for approval as a substitute. Note that not all courses are offered each semester.
